events.message: The applicant submitted the initial auto loan application to purchase a new car, providing basic personal details and loan amount requested.
The application was reviewed by the system and categorised correctly as an auto loan request based on keywords such as 'car' and 'vehicle'.
A loan officer was assigned to the case to handle the processing and maintain communication with the applicant regarding next steps.
The assigned loan officer started an initial review of the application documents and background information to assess suitability.
Additional documents were requested from the applicant including proof of income, insurance details, and vehicle information.
The applicant provided all requested documents promptly, ensuring clarity and completeness for further processing.
A credit check was carried out to evaluate the applicant’s credit score and history relevant to the requested auto loan.
Risk assessment results were compiled, reviewing financial stability, repayment ability, and potential risk factors.
An auto loan offer was presented to the applicant detailing approved loan amount, interest rate, and repayment schedule.
The applicant responded with acceptance of the terms and confirmed intent to proceed with the loan as offered.
The application was escalated to senior management for approval due to the loan amount exceeding initial thresholds.
Senior management approved the auto loan application after due diligence and confirmation of supporting documents.
The loan amount was successfully disbursed to the applicant’s nominated account to facilitate the purchase of the new vehicle.
A follow-up call was made to the applicant to ensure satisfaction with the loan process and address any outstanding queries.
The application file was officially closed after successful funding and confirmation that all conditions were met.
